title: Webinar â€œMarketing is Meaning: Why Every Hospitality Professional Needs a Marketing Mindsetâ€ with Professor Leora Lanz
description: â€œMarketing is Meaning: Why Every Hospitality Leader Needs a Marketing Mindsetâ€A conversation with Leora Lanz on bridging generations through strategy, empathy, and ownership.Join us for an interesting Webinar!ğŸ“… November 12, at 3pm CETZOOM Link:Â https://us02web.zoom.us/j/3810697601?omn=85488390719 (ID : 381 069 7601)During this webinar, Leora will share:âœ¨ The big ideas behind her mantraÂ â€œThink like a marketer. Act like an ownerâ€âœ¨ Stories from her global career and IMHI case studies featured in the bookâœ¨ Practical ways to make your marketing more purposeful, personal, and profitableAnd ...an exclusive, complimentary bonus chapter for all attendants!Title: Developing Your Marketing Mindset: Real-World Lessons from HospitalityAuthor: Leora LanzğŸ“–Â Summary:Leora Lanz's book is more than a marketing manual, itâ€™s a strategic call to action for anyone in hospitality (or beyond) to adopt a marketing mindset. This means thinking critically, acting with purpose, and embracing the dual role of creator and owner.Divided into three parts, the book moves from foundational thinking ("Think like a marketer. title: HEC Global Impact Community : launch webinar!
description: Dear all,Imagine being part of a global, English-speaking network of changemakers connected to HEC Paris â€” one where you can:Find peers and collaborators who speak the same impact language.Â Unlock resources, insights, and deal flow from across the world.Â Bridge the gap between regions and disciplines to scale your work.Thatâ€™s the vision behind the HEC Paris Global Impact Community â€” and we want you to help us build it.This initiative will unite HEC Paris-connected professionals active in impact â€” alumni, certificate holders, professors, Station F innovators, Mercure Award honorees, and peers from HEC Paris campuses worldwide â€” in one global, English-speaking network.Why? Because most of HEC Parisâ€™s strongest networks today are France-focused and French-speaking. While powerful, they leave out a large portion of the community who are based outside France or operate primarily in English. This initiative intends to bridge that gap, creating a space where every member of the HEC Paris ecosystem, wherever they are, can connect meaningfully in English as a shared language.Who weâ€™re looking for:ğŸŒÂ Impact entrepreneurs scaling ventures with social or environmental missionsÂ ğŸ’¸Â Impact investors seeking deal flow, pipeline, or co-investorsÂ ğŸŒ±Â Sustainability & CSR executives driving change from inside organizationsÂ ğŸ¢Â Intrapreneurs pushing transformation in large companiesÂ ğŸ”„Â Career shifters moving from corporate into purpose-driven workÂ ğŸ“Â Academics & policy shapers eager to translate ideas into actionÂ ğŸ“ŠÂ Consultants & advisors supporting sustainability journeysWhat youâ€™ll gain from this initiative and webinar:Â âœ”Â Access to a curated peer network of changemakers worldwideâœ”Â Opportunities to share deals, raise funds, and grow ideasâœ”Â Insights from peers tackling impact challenges across regionsâœ” An opportunity to be one of our first co-founders and membersÂ so you can co-create this community with usWho are we:Â The HEC Global Impact Community was born from a shared vision among HEC Paris alumni and partners who believe business can â€” and should â€” be a force for good. What began as conversations between changemakers across continents has evolved into a collective effort to connect the global HEC ecosystem around sustainability, innovation, and impact.Our founding circle brings together entrepreneurs, investors, educators, and advisors who are reimagining how business, policy, and finance can work together to create a more inclusive and regenerative economy.With the support of Entrepreneurs HEC Club, Hub Entreprendre HEC, and HEC Transition, this initiative bridges the academic, entrepreneurial, and sustainability pillars of HEC Paris â€” creating a space where ideas, capital, and purpose meet to accelerate positive change worldwide.Join one of our two launch webinars, and be part of shaping the future of impact within the HEC Paris ecosystem.ğŸ¯Â What to expect:The story and purpose behind the HEC Global Impact CommunityWhat it means to be a co-founderNext steps for joining and shaping our regional communitiesWebinar 1Â ğŸ“… November 4 at 09:00 CETÂ ğŸŒ Time zones: NYC 04:00 | SÃ£o Paulo 05:00 | Kinshasa 09:00 | Paris 09:00 | Dubai 12:00 | Mumbai 13:30 | Hong Kong 16:00 | Sydney 19:00Reserve Your Spot: https://luma.com/zm32m9kcWebinar 2Â ğŸ“… November 12 at 17:00 CETÂ ğŸŒ Time zones: NYC 11:00 | SÃ£o Paulo 13:00 | Kinshasa 17:00 | Paris 17:00 | Dubai 20:00 | Mumbai 21:30 | Hong Kong 00:00 | Sydney 03:00 (Nov 13)Reserve Your Spot: https://luma.com/4qrqjol1

Her work focuses on storytelling, empowerment, and building communities.Alice BlackAlice is the CEO and Founder ofÂ ArtULTRA, an artist management and advisory consultancy championing a more inclusive and forward-thinking art world. Formerly Co-Director of Londonâ€™s Design Museum (2007â€“2020), she led its award-winning redevelopment in Kensington, and in 2018 the museum was named European Museum of the Year. Alice is a Governor of the London Museum, chairs its Trading Board, and serves on the Council of the Royal Academy of Arts and the British Library Advisory Committee.Interactive Sessions (19:45 â€“ 20:30)You will choose one of the following experiential workshops to explore the art of encounter from a fresh perspective:1. The Art of Meeting Through ChocolateFacilitator: Nadae Cherradi, Founder of Lalla ChocolatNadae is a lifelong chocolate lover from Morocco whose journey across Canada, France, Australia, and Costa Rica deepened her fascination with cacaoâ€™s richness and diversity. After creating indulgent vegan truffles to suit her dairy intolerance, she foundedÂ Lalla ChocolatÂ as an ode to flavour, wellbeing, and Moroccan hospitality.In this sensory workshop, youâ€™ll explore connection through the language of taste. In small groups, youâ€™ll take part in a blind tasting of handcrafted vegan trufflesâ€”decoding texture, intensity, and emotion. Expect rich conversation, surprising pairings, and a delicious reflection on what makes something (or someone) truly memorable.2. Who Am I When I Shine? â€“ The Art of Authentic EncounterFacilitator: ValÃ©rie Maure, Executive Coach & Founder, Oxygen AdvisoryValÃ©rie is an executive coach who blends strategic clarity with human depth, helping leaders and teams align purpose, performance, and presence. After three decades in leadership roles at Accenture, Apple, and IBM, she now designs experiences that invite reflection, laughter and real conversation, creating space for people to show up fully as who they are.In a world of constant networking, memorable encounters donâ€™t come from perfect pitches but rather from authentic presence!In this highly interactive 45-minute workshop, ValÃ©rie will guide you through a playful and reflective journey to explore who you are when you connect at your best. Through coaching-inspired conversations and creative reflection, youâ€™ll uncover what makes you memorable, practice deep listening, and leave with a clearer sense of your authentic signature so your next encounter feels more genuine, energising, and human.3. Improvisation & the Memorable First EncounterFacilitators: Henri BrugÃ¨re & CÃ©cile Loyen, French British ImprovisationHenri is a French actor, writer, and director based in London for over a decade. He works across theatre, film, and improvisation, and leads workshops on public speaking and performance.CÃ©cile is an improviser with over 15 years of experience leading theatre workshops for children and adults in London and internationally. She is an active member of theÂ French British Improvisation (FBI)Â troupe, performing and teaching regularly.The French British Improvisation invites you to a highly participatory and playful improvisation workshop, where we will explore how improvisation can help anyone create memorable first encounters and capture the attention of the people they meet. No theatre or improvisation experience required!4. Are You Listening or Are You Listening? â€“ The Art of Active ListeningFacilitators: Jacques Balducci & Marileen Koppenberg, Executive Coaches and Career AdvisorsJacques is a Certified Professional Coach and International Career Advisor atÂ EDHEC Alumni, supporting graduates through career transitions, leadership development, and organisational change. With over 25 years of international experience in media and audience measurement atÂ MÃ©diamÃ©trie,Â Euronews, andÂ TF1, he now helps executives and teams enhance performance and navigate change with confidence.Marileen is anÂ ICF-accredited executive coachÂ and communications consultant with a background in finance. After starting her career atÂ JP MorganÂ in investment banking and asset management, she now works with clients to build confidence, strengthen their presence, and manage key transitions. She is a trustee ofÂ City Pay It ForwardÂ and a board member ofÂ EDHEC UK Alumni, and holds anÂ MBA from the University of Notre Dame.Have you ever wondered whether you are actually a good listener? How would you know?Is your ability to listen as important as your ability to speak?If this is tickling your curiosity, be ready to be surprised.Come and join us for this interactive workshop on the art of Active Listening and reconnect with this priceless skill that is available to us all.Closing & Networking (20:30 â€“ 21:30)Continue conversations sparked during the evening over drinks and food. Reconnect with old friends, meet new people, and reflect on what makes encounters truly memorable.We look forward to seeing you there and crafting together an evening of memorable encounters!â€” The Whats4u Team

title: EDHEC Alumni UK Career Days | Whats4u London Mixer | The Art of Encounter
location: HEC UK House, 43 Parker St, WC2B 5PS, London, GB
description: Whats4u London Mixer 2025The Art of Encounter: What Makes an Encounter MemorableÂ Â Wednesday 12 NovemberÂ âˆ£ 6.30pm UK time | HEC UK HouseFollowing the tremendous success of the first-ever Whats4U London Mixer in 2024, join the 2025 edition, an inspiring evening exploring â€œThe Art of Encounter: What Makes an Encounter Memorable?â€Expect an engaging talk and a series of interactive, hands-on activities to explore how meaningful connections are created and nurtured. The evening blends playful and thought-provoking moments designed to spark genuine conversations across alumni communities.And of course, it wouldnâ€™t be the London Mixer without plenty of time to mingle and enjoy a convivial evening over food and drinks.Programme Overview18:30 â€“ 18:45 WelcomeArrival, registration, and welcome drinks.18:45 â€“ 19:45 Inspiring Talk: â€œThe Art of Encounterâ€A conversation with three leaders from the worlds of recruitment, media, and art, exploring what makes human encounters truly memorable.Featuring Myriam Vacher, EDHEC Alumna 2002.Â 19:45 â€“ 20:30 Interactive SessionsSmall-group workshops designed to deepen reflection and connection through experience:The Art of Meeting Through ChocolateWho Am I When I Shine? â€“ The Art of Authentic EncounterÂ Improvisation & the Memorable First EncounterÂ Are You Listening or Are You Listening? â€“ The Art of Active ListeningÂ - Led by EDHEC AlumniÂ 20:30 â€“ 21:30 Networking & ClosingContinue the conversation over food and drinks.EDHEC Alumni UK-led workshop: The Art ofÂ Active Listening"Are you listening or are you listening?"Â Have you ever wondered whether you are actually a good listener? How would you know?Is your ability to listen as important as your ability to speak? If this is tickling your curiosity, be ready to be surprised. Come and join us for this interactive workshop on the art of Active Listening and reconnect with this priceless skill that is available to us all.The workshop will be led by:Marileen KoppenbergÂ (EDHEC 1997), Certified Coach, Official EDHEC Alumni UK Coach and Head of the EDHEC Alumni UK Career CommitteeMarileen graduated from EDHEC Grande Ecole in Lille in 1997. She is an ICF accredited executive coach, a consultant in communications and has had a lengthy career in finance. Prior to coaching, Marileen spent 12 years in investment management as a Credit research analyst at JP Morgan Asset Management. She began her career in investment banking at JP Morgan in Debt Capital Markets. She now works with a range of clients across all levels of seniority to help them establish their professional presence, increase their confidence, and navigate challenging transitions. Marileen has been an active member of the EDHEC UK Alumni Board since 2022 with a specific focus on career progression and development. Marileen is also a trustee with City Pay It Forward, a UK charity that focuses on promoting and delivering financial literacy in primary and secondary schools. She holds an MBA from the University of Notre Dame, USA. Marileen is Dutch, grew up in France and started her career in London which became her home.Jacques Balducci, Certified Professional Coach & International Career Advisor at EDHEC Alumni.Jacques is a Certified Professional Coach and International Career Advisor at EDHEC Alumni, supporting graduates through career transitions, leadership development, and organisational challenges. He brings over 25 years of international experience in media and audience measurement, having served as International Commercial Director at MÃ©diamÃ©trie and previously held senior roles at Euronews and TF1. Alongside his work at EDHEC, Jacques runs his own coaching practice, helping executives and teams enhance performance and navigate change.Whats4UEDHEC AlumniÂ is proud to be part of Whats4U, a collective of 17 alumni associations from leading Grandes Ã‰coles fostering collaboration, connection, and professional growth across alumni networks.More details: https://www.whats4u.org/enPRACTICAL INFORMATIONDateÂ : Wednesday 12th NovemberÂ Times: 6.30pm-9.30pm Â Location: HEC UK HouseÂ Tube station: HolbornREGISTRATIONPlease register via the Eventbrite link.If you have any questions, weâ€™re here for you. Feel free to email us at ukboard@alumni.edhec.edu or call Audrey, EDHEC Country Manager for the UK & Ireland, atÂ 07938 603045. Weâ€™ll be delighted to assist you.We very much look forward to welcoming you.Warm regards,Your EDHEC Alumni UK Board - Career Committee

Expect a blend of playful and thought-provoking moments designed to spark conversations and deepen connections across alumni communities.Â And of course, it wouldnâ€™t be the London Mixer without plenty of time to mingle and enjoy a convivial evening over food and drinks.PROGRAM OVERVIEWÂ 18:30 â€“ 18:45: Welcome drinksÂ 18:45 â€“ 19:45â€ƒInspiring Talk: â€œThe Art of Encounterâ€: a conversation with three leaders from the worlds of recruitment, media, and art, exploring what makes human encounters truly memorable.SpeakersMyriam VacherMyriam Vacher is an executive search professional specialising in technology leadership. Over the past decade, she has supported founders, investors, and boards across Europe in navigating senior hiring needs during critical growth moments. Her career spans strategy consulting, M&A, and finance across industry and professional services.Â Myriam holds degrees from IMD, the London School of Economics, and EDHEC Business School.VÃ©ronique Forge-KaribianVÃ©ronique Forge-Karibian is a journalist and media entrepreneur. She has hosted TV programmes and news magazines on French television, including Femmes dâ€™Exception. She is also the founder of Business O FÃ©minin, a digital media platform and professional network with over 70,000 subscribers, and the creator of the Power Girl podcast. Her work focuses on storytelling, empowerment, and building communities.Alice BlackAlice black is the CEO and Founder of ArtULTRA, an artist management and advisory consultancy championing a more inclusive and forward-thinking art world. Formerly Co-Director of Londonâ€™s Design Museum (2007â€“2020), she led its award-winning redevelopment in Kensington, and in 2018 the museum was named European Museum of the Year. Alice is a Governor of the London Museum, chairs its Trading Board, and serves on the Council of the Royal Academy of Arts and the British Library Advisory Committee.19:45 â€“ 20:30â€ƒInteractive Session: Small-group workshops designed to deepen reflection and connection through experience. Choose one of the following experiential workshop:Â The Art of Meeting Through ChocolateFacilitator: Nadae Cherradi, Founder of Lalla ChocolatNadae is a lifelong chocolate lover from Morocco whose journey across Canada, France, Australia, and Costa Rica deepened her fascination with cacaoâ€™s richness and diversity. After creating indulgent vegan truffles to suit her dairy intolerance, she founded Lalla Chocolat as an ode to flavour, wellbeing, and Moroccan hospitality.Â In this sensory workshop, youâ€™ll explore connection through the language of taste. In small groups, youâ€™ll take part in a blind tasting of handcrafted vegan trufflesâ€”decoding texture, intensity, and emotion. Expect rich conversation, surprising pairings, and a delicious reflection on what makes something (or someone) truly memorable.Â Who Am I When I Shine? â€“ The Art of Authentic EncounterFacilitator: ValÃ©rie Maure, Executive Coach & Founder, Oxygen AdvisoryValÃ©rie is an executive coach who blends strategic clarity with human depth, helping leaders and teams align purpose, performance, and presence. Â In this highly interactive 45-minute workshop, ValÃ©rie will guide you through a playful and reflective journey to explore who you are when you connect at your best. Through coaching-inspired conversations and creative reflection, youâ€™ll uncover what makes you memorable, practice deep listening, and leave with a clearer sense of your authentic signature so your next encounter feels more genuine, energising, and human.Improvisation & the Memorable First EncounterFacilitators: Henri BrugÃ¨re & CÃ©cile Loyen, French British ImprovisationHenri is a French actor, writer, and director based in London for over a decade. He works across theatre, film, and improvisation, and leads workshops on public speaking and performance.Â CÃ©cile is an improviser with over 15 years of experience leading theatre workshops for children and adults in London and internationally.Â Â The French British Improvisation invites you to a highly participatory and playful improvisation workshop, where we will explore how improvisation can help anyone create memorable first encounters and capture the attention of the people they meet. No theatre or improvisation experience required!Are You Listening or Are You Listening? â€“ The Art of Active ListeningFacilitators:Â Jacques Balducci & Marileen Koppenberg, Executive Coaches and Career AdvisorsJacques is a Certified Professional Coach and International Career Advisor atÂ EDHEC Alumni, supporting graduates through career transitions, leadership development, and organisational change. With over 25 years of international experience in media and audience measurement atÂ MÃ©diamÃ©trie,Â Euronews, andÂ TF1, he now helps executives and teams enhance performance and navigate change with confidence.Marileen is an ICF-accredited executive coach and communications consultant with a background in finance. After starting her career at JP Morgan in investment banking and asset management, she now works with clients to build confidence, strengthen their presence, and manage key transitions. She is a trustee of City Pay It Forward and a board member of EDHEC UK Alumni, and holds an MBA from the University of Notre Dame.20:30 â€“ 21:30â€ƒNetworking & Closing: Continue the conversation over food and drinks.REGISTEREVENT SUMMARYÂ Date: Wednesday 12th NovemberÂ Time: 6:30pm to 9:30pmÂ Format: Networking and drinks. Food will be providedÂ Address: HEC UK House 43 Parker Street WC2B 5PS - Map hereRegisterÂ here

title: EDHEC Alumni UK Career Days | In-person Career Coaching Sessions | London Campus
location: EDHEC London Campus, 10, Fleet Place, EC4M 7RB, LONDON, GB
description: EDHEC Alumni Career DaysIn-person Career Coaching Sessions on EDHEC London CampusÂ Â Thursday 13 NovemberÂ âˆ£ From 8.30am to 6.15pmALL THE SESSIONS ARE FULLY BOOKEDReady to take your career to the next level?Join us on campus for a special in-person coaching dayÂ dedicated to your professional growth and well-being.Each year, every UK-based alumnus/a is entitled to a complimentary coaching session with our official Alumni Coach, Marileen Koppenberg (EDHEC 1997).Â This year, weâ€™re making it even more personal by hosting a full day of face-to-face sessions on the EDHEC London Campus.Marileen will be joined by Jacques Balducci, Certified Professional Coach and International Career Advisor at EDHEC Alumni, to offer exclusive one-hour sessions tailored to your career goals and challenges.These sessions are ideal if you are:HesitatingÂ on how to approach a new job searchConsideringÂ a transition into a different sectorNavigatingÂ challenges in your current roleFeeling stuck or unfulfilled in your jobFacing difficult work relationshipsWe hope youâ€™ll seize this opportunity to invest in your next career step!WHO YOU WILL MEETMarileen Koppenberg, EDHEC 1997Certified Coach, EDHEC Alumni UK Coach and Head of the EDHEC Alumni UK Career CommitteeMarileen graduated from EDHEC Grande Ecole in Lille in 1997. She is an ICF accredited executive coach, a consultant in communications and has had a lengthy career in finance. Prior to coaching, Marileen spent 12 years in investment management as a Credit research analyst at JP Morgan Asset Management. She began her career in investment banking at JP Morgan in Debt Capital Markets. She now works with a range of clients across all levels of seniority to help them establish their professional presence, increase their confidence, and navigate challenging transitions. Marileen has been an active member of the EDHEC UK Alumni Board since 2022 with a specific focus on career progression and development. Marileen is also a trustee with City Pay It Forward, a UK charity that focuses on promoting and delivering financial literacy in primary and secondary schools. She holds an MBA from the University of Notre Dame, USA. Â Marileen is Dutch, grew up in France and started her career in London which became her home.Jacques BalducciCertified Professional CoachÂ International Career Advisor, EDHEC AlumniJacques is a Certified Professional Coach and International Career Advisor at EDHEC Alumni, supporting graduates through career transitions, leadership development, and organisational challenges. He brings over 25 years of international experience in media and audience measurement, having served as International Commercial Director at MÃ©diamÃ©trie and previously held senior roles at Euronews and TF1. Alongside his work at EDHEC, Jacques runs his own coaching practice, helping executives and teams enhance performance and navigate change.HOW TO BOOK YOUR COMPLIMENTARY COACHING SESSIONAvailable slots (London time):08:30 â€“ 09:30AM09:45 â€“ 10:45AM11:00 â€“ 12:00AM12:30 â€“ 13:30PM13:45 â€“ 14:45PM15:00 â€“ 16:00PM16:15 â€“ 17:15PM17:30 â€“ 18:30PMHow to book:Please email one of the coaches with your preferred time slot(s):Marileen: mbkoppenberg@gmail.comJacques: jacques.balducci@edhec.eduYouâ€™ll receive a short pre-coaching form to confirm your booking.MANY THANKS. ALL THE SESSIONS ARE FULLY BOOKED.Â PRACTICAL INFORMATIONDateÂ : Thursday 13th NovemberÂ Times: From 8.30am to 6.15pmÂ Location: EDHEC London CampusTube stations: St Paul's, Blackfriars, FarringdonÂ We very much look forward to welcoming you.Warm regards,Your EDHEC Alumni UK Board - Career Committee

description: A vos agendas !En accord avec le CollÃ¨ge de France, vous Ãªtes conviÃ©s Ã  assister Ã  la confÃ©rence d'Emmanuelle PasseguÃ©,Â Directrice de la Columbia Stem Cell Initiative et professeure Ã©mÃ©rite de gÃ©nÃ©tique et de dÃ©veloppement Ã  l'universitÃ© Columbia ADAPTATIVE AND MALADAPTATIVE MYELOID CELL PRODUCTIONqui aura lieuÂ jeudi 13Â novembreÂ 2025Â de 17h30 Ã  18h30 dans l'AmphithÃ©Ã¢tre Mireille Delmas-Marty.â€œAlthough highly regulated to maintain stable output of blood cells in health, the hematopoietic system is capable of extensive remodeling in response to external challenges, prioritizing production of certain blood cell types at the expense of others. We will consider how acute insults, such as infections and myeloablation, cause molecular, cellular, and metabolic changes in hematopoietic stem and progenitor cells at multiple levels of the hematopoietic hierarchy to drive accelerated production of mature myeloid cells needed to resolve the initiating insult. description: Lift myths and beliefs about a little-known profession and discover the secrets to boost your career and/or your projectsÂ This workshop will give you all the keys to understand the job of headhunter:Â â€¢ What is an executive search firm?Â â€¢ Understand the differences between themÂ â€¢ Why does a company use the service of a headhunter?Â â€¢ Understand how they work and what they deliver to their clientsÂ â€¢ How do a consultant proceed and how does he select candidates ?Â â€¢ Understand the positioning of the consultant towards client & candidatesÂ â€¢ How to get chased? ... And how to hunt headhunters?Â â€¢ Ask everything you have ever wanted to know about the jobAt the end of this workshop:Â â€¢ You will discover how to be more visibleÂ â€¢ You will understand how headhunters can help you grow professionallyÂ â€¢ You will understand how they can help you in your recruitmentÂ â€¢ You will dare to use this profession for your projects Â This workshop is for you if... :Â â€¢ You would be interested in changing your job or you are actively looking for a new positionÂ â€¢ You want to develop your network in caseâ€¦Â â€¢ You want to use an executive search firms for your recruitment projects but do not know how it worksIn Summary:Â As an expert in recruitment, change and therefore career development, the headhunter is there to support leaders and guide them on the paths of professional advancement: Evaluate their professional and personal assets, redefine a project and a career strategy, help them find a new position but also find a talent for their teams, advise them and be at their side in a business project: a winning duo! Â The speaker: ClÃ©mence CojeanÂ has 20 years of experience in recruitment. Before joining the headhunting industry in 2012, she worked for 10 years for one of the world's leading engineering consulting companies. Today, she advises clients from different sectors, in a process of trust and partnership, in their search for senior executives and executives in France and abroad. Having lived 5 years as an expatriate in Europe, she notes that the way of recruiting and developing its career has changed in recent years and that it is becoming essential to adapt to new digital channels and to have a perfectly mastered digital identity. She is today one of the LinkedIn experts on the French market

title: CarriÃ¨re - Boost Luxe "searching for your first job in the luxury sector" - Masterclass 2
description: L'EDHEC Career Center for life invites you to participate Boost Luxe "searching for your first job in the luxury sector".You must participate in all masterclasses.This Masterclass is reserved for young Master and BBA graduates seeking their first jobThe Fashion and Luxury market has its own codes. Securing a position within this industry requires business sector knowledge, specific soft skills aligned with the companyâ€™s values and business model, and a deep understanding of the customerâ€™s experience. Â During those 3 webinars, you will be provided with the codes to identify career opportunities that will perfectly reflect your personal and professional aspirations all through different steps: Â Â The first track offers an in-depth analysis of the business models of fashion and luxury houses to better grasp HR-related challenges. The second track will enable you to structure and optimize application materials to stand out from other candidates and align with company expectations in terms of professional identity, culture, and brand DNA. Finally, the last track will give you the keys to understanding the structure of HR interviews to build a coherent and impactful narrative that reflects both technical and interpersonal skills developed throughout the academic journey.Â Â Details of masterclasses :Â Masterclass 1 - Analysis of business models of Fashion and Luxury houses to acknowledge sectors - 20 October at 5 p.m.Masterclass 2 - Build a strong application form to stand out and structure your career plan - 17 November at 5 p.m.Masterclass 3 - Develop a strong speech to perform during interviews to secure a position - 4 December at 5 p.m.These presentations will be the right support to optimize your professional integration. Â Automotive industry, Hospitality, Jewelry and many others; all sectors of activity will be developed for you to embrace the core essence of the business. Consider these masterclasses as a career guidance tool to support your internship/job search.SpeakerJanice MbengoWith a Luxury Management MBA, I began my career in Luxury and Fashion companies in several positions in retail, marketing and recruiting. For 4 years as a Recruitment Consultant I supported my clients' recruitments needs, identifying candidates whose skills matched their culture and professional expectations. Certified in personality assessments for recruitment purposes, I have been managing the hiring process, analyzing soft and hard skills, for international leading companies such as LVMH, Richemont and independent houses. During my different job positions I gained exposure to a number of companies allowing me to develop a strong expertise of the job market in the luxury sector. Now, as a Career coach from 2019, I conduct workshops and pedagogical content to develop future graduates' employability skills.

title: HEMATOPOIETIC STEM CELL AGING AND ADAPTATION TO STRESS
location: CollÃ¨ge de France, 11 place Marcelin Berthelot, 75005, PARIS, FR
description: A vos agendas !En accord avec le CollÃ¨ge de France, vous Ãªtes conviÃ©s Ã  assister Ã  la confÃ©rence d'Emmanuelle PasseguÃ©,Â Directrice de la Columbia Stem Cell Initiative et professeure Ã©mÃ©rite de gÃ©nÃ©tique et de dÃ©veloppement Ã  l'universitÃ© Columbia HEMATOPOIETIC STEM CELL AGING AND ADAPTATION TO STRESSqui aura lieuÂ mardi 18Â novembreÂ 2025Â de 17h30 Ã  18h30 dans l'AmphithÃ©Ã¢tre Mireille Delmas-Marty.â€œAlthough young adult HSCs employ finely tuned mechanisms to balance pro-survival and stress responses, these maintenance strategies provoke vulnerabilities that manifest with continued age, leading to a decline in function. We will examine HSC biology through the lens of antagonistic pleiotropy, whereby the same mechanisms that are important for reproductive fitness form the basis for functional decline during aging. We will particularly highlight the central role of cell cycle regulation, niche cell reliance, inflammatory responses, cellular memory, and distinct metabolic regulation in driving HSC aging features, including expansion of the HSC pool, decreased self-renewal ability, myeloid-biased differentiation, and genomic instability leading to clonal hematopoiesis (CH) and leukemic transformation.â€Pour en savoir plus, veuillez cliquerÂ ici.L'accÃ¨s en prÃ©sentiel est libre, dans la limite des places disponibles.Pour toute question, nâ€™hÃ©sitez pas Ã  nous contacter par e-mail.Retrouvez les prochaines manifestations santÃ© que nous vous recommandons dans l'Agenda du Hub SantÃ©Â iciÂ et dans l'Agenda du Club SantÃ©Â ici

title: Impact Workshop by ESSEC Alumni  - From Obligation to Opportunity: How CSRD/Omnibus Is Shaping Sustainable Business
description: From Obligation to Opportunity: How CSRD/Omnibus Is Shaping Sustainable BusinessThursday, November 20th12:30 PM â€“ 13:30 PMFor the first time, we are teaming up with AXA Climate, ESSEC Executive Education, and a guest speaker from Henkel for a powerful discussion on how CSRD/Omnibus is transforming business from a compliance exercise into an opportunity for positive impact.In just one hour, youâ€™ll gain actionable insights and a fresh perspective on a key challenge of the ecological and social transition â€” and leave ready to put them into practice.ABOUT THE WEBINARSustainability reporting is undergoing a major transformation. What was once a voluntary practice is now becoming a strategic and regulatory imperative. The Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD) and the accompanying Omnibus Act are setting new standards and expectations, not just for EU-based companies, but globally. Join us for an insightful 1-hour session where top experts from academia, industry, investment, and consulting come together to explore the evolution, current landscape, and future implications of sustainability reporting.This session will be moderated by Valerie Hutterer, Head of DACH Market at AXA Climate School, and will provide a dynamic blend of expertise, real-life corporate examples, and practical tools to help you navigate this complex, fast-evolving topic.AGENDA20 min â€“ The Past: Where It All BeganEvolution of sustainability reportingOrigins of CSRD and investor influenceKey moments and lessons from the past30 min â€“ The Present & Future: Where Weâ€™re HeadedWhat CSRD and the Omnibus Act mean todayHow companies are responding and adaptingTools and support available for compliance and beyond10 min â€“ Live Q&AAsk your questions directly to our panel of experts.KEY TAKEAWAYSBy the end of this session, you will:Â Understand the evolution and objectives of CSRD and the Omnibus ActÂ Learn how leading companies like Henkel are navigating the changesÂ Gain investor and regulatory perspectives on sustainability reportingÂ Access practical tools and tips to prepare your organizationÂ Get answers to your most pressing questions during the live Q&ASPEAKERS :Â Uwe BERGMANN,Â Global Director ESG Business Integration, HenkelUwe Bergmann is Corporate Director ESG Reporting, Disclosure and Business Integration at Henkel. He leads Henkel's ESG reporting and disclosures, ESG related engagements with investors and regulators, as well as the strategic integration of sustainability into its core business and risk management. Over the last 25 years he played a central role in shaping Henkelâ€™s sustainability strategy and driving its implementation together with Henkelâ€™s business units and functions. He holds a M.Sc. in Environmental Technology from Imperial College, London and a B.Sc. in Environmental Sciences from the University of East Anglia, Norwich. Prior to joining Henkel in 2000, he worked as a Researcher and Consultant at the Institute for Environmental Management at the European Business School, in Oestrich-Winkel, Germany.Â Dr. Chrystelle RICHARD - Â Professor of Accounting at ESSEC Business School | IAASB Member | ANC MemberDr. Chrystelle Richard teaches financial accounting and sustainability reporting, and her primary research interests focus on firms' oversight and new forms of economic governance. Dr. Richard has published in renowned academic journals and has received the â€œProfessor Teaching Awardâ€ (2021) and the â€œJuryâ€™s Special Prizeâ€ (2025) from the ESSEC Foundation. She has also taken on leadership roles in academic associations in her field. She is currently a board member of the International Auditing and Assurance Standards Board (IAASB) and the AutoritÃ© des Normes Comptables (ANC), the French accounting standard-setting authority. Dr. Richard is a former student of the Ã‰cole Normale SupÃ©rieure and holds a Ph.D. in Management Studies.Â Niranjan RAGHAVANÂ - Domain Leader - Sustainable Finance AXA ClimateÂ Niranjan is a Domain Leader for Sustainable Finance in AXA Climateâ€™s Financial Services Advisory team, based in Paris. He has 10+ years of experience as an engineer, consultant and investment manager, focused on energy transition, climate change and decarbonization services. He also has a vast experience in supporting Banks and private equity clients on Fund- and PortCo- level ESG advisory and Regulatory reporting strategies, notably on SFDR, EU Taxonomy and CSRD Reporting. Previously, he was a Project Manager at ERM France's M&A Advisory and the technical lead for SFDR and EU Taxonomy topics, an investment manager with Marble, and a senior consultant with IAC Partners and an operations engineer in the mobility sector with Schaeffler and Faurecia in North America. Niranjan has a master's degree in Energy Engineering and Management from Ecole Polytechnique France, and a masterâ€™s in mechanical engineering from Clemson University USA.Panel moderator :Â Valerie HUTTERER â€“ Head of DACH market, AXA Climate SchoolÂ Valerie Hutterer drives climate education across the DACH region and the Netherlands as Head of Market - Training at AXA Climate. Her work focuses on equipping companies with the knowledge and tools to navigate the climate transitionâ€”transforming awareness into business-wide action. With a background in European policy, international organisations, and a Masterâ€™s in Sociology & Climate Change, she brings a sharp, interdisciplinary lens to the challenges of the sustainable transformation.REGISTRATIONRegistration is now open through the form below.This webinar is free and exclusively for ESSEC Alumni (graduates and current students) as well as members of the G16+ alumni network (Agro, Arts & MÃ©tiers, CPA, EDHEC, EM Lyon, ENA, ENS, ESCP/EAP, HEC, IAE Paris, INSEAD, Mines, Ponts, Sciences Po, Supaero, CentraleSupÃ©lec, Sup Telecom, X, ENSTA).IMAGE RIGHTSAt ESSEC Alumni, we love capturing and sharing the highlights of our events through photos and videos on our communication channels (brochures, newsletters, articles, Reflets magazine, social media, websites, etc.).If youâ€™d prefer not to be filmed or photographed, simply let us know by email (claire.hallier@essec.edu) before the event.A replay will be shared with all participants and posted on the ESSEC Alumni YouTube channel. If you donâ€™t wish to appear in the replay, we invite you to use a pseudonym and keep your camera turned off during the session.Thank you for your understandingCOPYRIGHT NOTICEIf a presentation and/or replay is shared after the webinar, we kindly ask that you keep it for your personal use only. Please do not distribute it, as a way to respect and value the speakerâ€™s work and intellectual property.#transition #csrd #impact #durabilitÃ©

title: HEC UK Art Club - A conversation with Joan Mirviss, a world expert and major dealer in Japanese art
description: HEC UK Art ClubA conversation with Joan Mirviss, a world expert and major dealer in Japanese art and CeramicsWednesday 20th NovemberÂ at 12:30pm (NYC) / 5:30pm (UK) / 6:30pm (CET)Â ONLINEAbout the webinarÂ About the speakerÂ Joan MirvissÂ is an expert and major dealer in Japanese art, specializing in ceramics, ukiyo-eÂ prints and paintings for over forty years. In the area of modern and contemporary Japanese ceramic art in the West, she has been the pioneering spirit and force behind this burgeoning field. Â As the foremost dealer in the field of modern and contemporary Japanese ceramics, she exclusively represents the top Japanese clay artists, both past and present. Mirviss has organized and mounted over ninety exhibitions of Japanese modern and contemporary ceramics at her New York gallery and international fairs, bringing the work of celebrated artists as well as hitherto unknown talents to the attention of the American public. Widely published and a highly respected specialist in her field, Mirviss has advised and built collections for many museums and private collectors. She is the co-founder of Asia Week New York Association and is a longtime member of The National Antiques & Art Dealers Association of America and CINOA.Â Mirviss received her M.A. in Japanese art history from Columbia University, and has written books and articles on a wide range of Japanese art-related subjects as well as lectured at museums and universities in the United States, Europe, and Japan. Her clients include more than sixty museums throughout the world.EVENT SUMMARYDate: Wednesday 20th November 2025Â Time:Â 12:30pm (NYC) /Â 5:30 pm (UK) / 6:30pm (CET)Â Format:Â Online workshop and Q&AÂ Ticket: Free registration

title: Webinar "Communicate with impact" - December 2
description: One of the main challenges that executives, managers and experts face in today's organizations is the lack of support from their boss and the poor collaboration across teams and silos. This often stems from communication issues, and it is not only frustrating, the consequences can be severe: delays in important initiatives, dificulties in bringing new products to market, safery risks... all with an impact on the bottom line.As organizations become more complex, communicating with impact so you can mobilize others becomes a core skills. If you'd like to foster collaboration, gain influence and grow your career through compelling communication, this webinar is for you.Speaker: As the founder of Career on Purpose, O'ona Souissi helps internationally-minded executives, managers and high-level experts to build a meaningful career.12:30 Paris time

title: The Cities of Tomorrow: How New Business Models Will Foster Regenerative Building
description: EDHEC Alumni UK "Make an Impact for Good" Sustainability ProgrammeThe Cities of TomorrowHow New Business Models will Foster Regenerative BuildingTuesday 2 December | 6.30pm UK time | Institut FranÃ§ais, LondonAfter the success of our last series of events on food security, biodiversity and the role of AI in driving a greener future, the EDHEC Alumni UK board's "Make an impact for Good" sustainability programme, held in partnership with the French Embassy in the UK and France Alumni, is delighted to invite you to another insightful conference on "The cities of Tomorrow".Â This event will showcase cutting-edge research from EDHECâ€™s Centre for Net Positive Business and feature a panel of expert speakers exploring how new business models can accelerate the transition to regenerative cities.Join us on 2 December at the Institut FranÃ§ais for a unique opportunity to:HearÂ the latest research from the EDHEC Centre for Net Positive BusinessÂ ExploreÂ leading use cases from Germany and Switzerland with direct relevance for LondonGainÂ diverse perspectives from corporates, public authorities, and start-ups on the regenerative built environmentNetworkÂ with senior sustainability professionals from across multiple sectorsEngageÂ with the EDHECâ€“ARUP Alliance on the Regenerative Built EnvironmentÂ Â SPEAKERSÂ Weâ€™re curating a line-up of expert leaders to bring you a high impact evening of insights and inspiration.Â Prof. RenÃ© RohrbeckProfessor of Strategy and Foresight, EDHEC Business SchoolDirector, EDHEC Centre for Net Positive BusinessRenÃ© Rohrbeckâ€™s research focusesÂ on strategic foresight, innovation, and sustainable business model transformation, with flagship programs on regenerative built environments and healthy nutrition. A frequent speaker at global forums such as the World Economic Forum, he is widely published on future preparedness and catalytic business models.Â Martin PauliDirector and Global Circular Economy Services Leader, ArupMartin PauliÂ advises governments and companies on circular product and business model innovation. He co-developed the influential Circular Buildings Toolkit with the Ellen MacArthur Foundation and serves on the German Sustainable Building Councilâ€™s Innovation Advisory Board. A recognised thought leader, he regularly speaks and lectures worldwide on advancing circularity in the built environment.Â AGENDA6.30PM: Registrations7.00 PM: Welcome remarks by the French Embassy in the UK & EDHEC Alumni UKÂ 7.05 PM: Engagement with the AudienceÂ 7.10PM: Keynote from EDHECâ€™s Centre for Net Positive Business and ARUPEDHEC Professor, RenÃ© RohrbeckÂ andÂ Martin Pauli, from the EDHECâ€“ARUP Alliance on the Regenerative Built Environment, will open the event by introducing catalytic business models and explaining why they are essential to fast-tracking the transition towards regenerative cities, illustrated through cases such as Enpal, district cooling in Geneva, and low-carbon transport.7.20 PM: Panel discussion8.00 PM: Q&AÂ 8.30 PM: Networking drinks10.00PM: End of the eventVENUEÂ Hosted in the beautiful Art Deco bibliothÃ¨que at the Institut FranÃ§ais, the event will be followed by a networking cocktail in the adjoining salons.Â MAKE AN IMPACT FOR GOODÂ Born from the passion for sustainability of dedicated members of the EDHEC Alumni UK Board, â€œMake an Impact for Goodâ€ is an ambitious initiative that raises awareness of todayâ€™s sustainability challenges, connects generations to co-create solutions, and strives to make a lasting positive impact on society.If you are interested in speaking at one of our events orÂ getting involved in the programme, please contact the UK team of "Make an Impact for Good" at:â€¯ukboard@alumni.edhec.edu. We would be delighted to collaborate with you.EDHEC CENTER FOR NET POSITIVE BUSINESSThe Centre for Net Positive Business explores and defines the pathways that enable businesses of all sizes to develop scalable models capable of driving systemic change. Its mission focuses on three key areas:Â Advancing towards a universally accepted measurement frameworkCatalyzingÂ regenerationÂ through collaborative and systemic business modelsHelping industries envision long-term trajectories to anticipate and overcome systemic obstacles.By connecting companies, alumni, students, and leading actors, the Centre creates a dynamic platform for collaboration and collective progress toward a regenerative future. EVENT PARTNERSÂ The EDHEC Alumni UK team behind the â€˜Make an Impact for Goodâ€™ sustainability programme was proud to be one of the two winners of the 2024 hackathon organised by the French Embassy in the UK. Since then, the team has benefited from the Embassyâ€™s support to expand its series of events to the entire France Alumni network in the UK.The France Alumni network brings together graduates from France's higher education system. It enables Alumni from a wide range of institutions to stay connected and benefit from professional opportunities.KlimateNetÂ is the "LinkedIn" for climate professionals and the "Trustpilot" for nature based climate projects. KlimateNet match make and connect professionals directly with project founders and funders on the KlimateNet App that is available on the Google and Apple stores in 63 countries. KlimateNet Project+ support scheme helps projects save costs and time to scale their positive environmental and social impact. KlimateNet Platform+ subscription servicesÂ contribute to de-risk the investments and efforts of organisations that invest or work with nature bases solutions projects.

title: Webinar "Never enough ! How to really thrive as an overachiever" - December 3
description: Join HEC Life Project and Ben Depraz (H.13) for this new webinar !Â "Success without fulfilment is the ultimate failure", says author, coach and speaker Tony Robbins.I believe each person must define these terms for themselves. Having said that, the typical overachiever experiences a lack of fulfilment because of their relentless drive to succeed. It takes great self-awareness and a healthy dose of courage for anyone to acknowledge that part of their drive is a sense of "not enough".Â This drive may lead - and frequently does so - to produce outstanding results and bring about conventional success. But it often comes with chronic dissatisfaction, intense pressure, stress, and concern for the future. The external world dominates the internal one. Being successful and miserable is not a desirableÂ outcome.Having worked 1-1 with more than a thousand professionals in venture capital, private equity and senior management in start-ups and corporations alike, I am sharing with you the set of principles that I found have helped many to overcome their "not enough-ness" and continue achieving from a new place of peace, happiness and trust.Our Speaker : Ben Depraz (H.13)Ben is an Executive Coach. He worked for nearly 8 years as Partner and Head of the Coaching Division at iDiscover 360, a cutting-edge educational institute and business consultancy based in London, which explores human development and human potential. Ben holds a double MSc in Corporate and Public Management from HEC Paris and Sciences Po. Paris (2013), and worked at HSBC in London before making a radical shift towards executive and life coaching in 2015. He has trained in a wide variety of fields related to human psychology and behaviour, including CBT, hypnosis, neuro-linguistic programming, philosophy, sales and leadership.Ben has worked with a wide range of startup founders, C-level executives, artists and business consultants, and has helped hundreds of people with challenges such as finding purpose, improving relationships, enhancing physical or mental performance, building emotional resilience and increasing prosperity.Find out more on www.big-coaching.com

title: CarriÃ¨re - Boost Luxe "searching for your first job in the luxury sector" - Masterclass 3
description: L'EDHEC Career Center for life invites you to participate Boost Luxe "searching for your first job in the luxury sector".You must participate in all masterclasses.This Masterclass is reserved for young Master's graduates seeking their first jobThe Fashion and Luxury market has its own codes. Securing a position within this industry requires business sector knowledge, specific soft skills aligned with the companyâ€™s values and business model, and a deep understanding of the customerâ€™s experience. Â During those 3 webinars, you will be provided with the codes to identify career opportunities that will perfectly reflect your personal and professional aspirations all through different steps: Â Â The first track offers an in-depth analysis of the business models of fashion and luxury houses to better grasp HR-related challenges. The second track will enable you to structure and optimize application materials to stand out from other candidates and align with company expectations in terms of professional identity, culture, and brand DNA. Finally, the last track will give you the keys to understanding the structure of HR interviews to build a coherent and impactful narrative that reflects both technical and interpersonal skills developed throughout the academic journey.Â Â Details of masterclasses :Â Masterclass 1 - Analysis of business models of Fashion and Luxury houses to acknowledge sectors - 20 October at 5 p.m.Masterclass 2 - Build a strong application form to stand out and structure your career plan - 17 November at 5 p.m.Masterclass 3 - Develop a strong speech to perform during interviews to secure a position - 4 December at 5 p.m.These presentations will be the right support to optimize your professional integration. Â Automotive industry, Hospitality, Jewelry and many others; all sectors of activity will be developed for you to embrace the core essence of the business. Consider these masterclasses as a career guidance tool to support your internship/job search.SpeakerJanice MbengoWith a Luxury Management MBA, I began my career in Luxury and Fashion companies in several positions in retail, marketing and recruiting. For 4 years as a Recruitment Consultant I supported my clients' recruitments needs, identifying candidates whose skills matched their culture and professional expectations. Certified in personality assessments for recruitment purposes, I have been managing the hiring process, analyzing soft and hard skills, for international leading companies such as LVMH, Richemont and independent houses. During my different job positions I gained exposure to a number of companies allowing me to develop a strong expertise of the job market in the luxury sector. Now, as a Career coach from 2019, I conduct workshops and pedagogical content to develop future graduates' employability skills.

title: EXPOSITION JACQUES-LOUIS DAVID
ALUMNI VOICES - Driving Growth at the Heart of Global Retail with Marion SAKOWSKI - Walmart - English session
description: Alumni share their career paths with studentsÂ liveÂ Â Session in EnglishDiscover how Marion SAKOWSKI, EDHEC BBAÂ 2012, turned her passion for strategy and innovation into a career leading business development for some of the worldâ€™s most iconic brands, including Deliveroo, Amazon and Walmart.Join us for an inspiring conversation with Marion, Director of Business Development at Walmart, who will share her journey from EDHEC to one of the largest companies in the world.She will give insights into what it means to shape growth strategies in a fast-evolving retail landscape and how her international career path has been shaped by curiosity, resilience, and impact-driven leadership.This interactive session will also be an opportunity for you to ask your questions and get valuable advice for your own career path.About WalmartWalmart is the worldâ€™s largest retailer, serving millions of customers every week across more than 19 countries. Founded in 1962, the company has revolutionized the way people shop through its omnichannel strategy combining stores and e-commerce.EVENT FORMAT1 hour of LIVE discussion, to ensure that the experience is as participative and rewarding as possible for everyone:- 30mn presentation by the Alumni (career path, professions, internship/job opportunities in their company and career prospects)- 30mn Q&A 3 session where students can ask their questions live.REGISTRATIONRegister for the Meeting by clicking on the â€˜registeringâ€™ button.Â You must be logged in to register, log in at the top left of the EDHEC ALUMNI website using your login email and password that you registered when you activated your account.NB: If you have not yet activated your account: click here, follow the instructions and then reconnect to the site to register for the event.What are Alumni VoicesThe ALUMNI VOICES programme aims to put EDHEC students and graduates in touch with each other. It is aimed at all EDHEC students, whatever their level or course of study.The aim of this event? To discover career prospects in the professions and business sectors covered by graduates, to help students define their professional projects and to enrich their network.

title: Leading with Impact Series
location: HEC UK House, 43 Parker Street, WC2B5PS, London, GB
description: We are delighted to invite you to the next session of our Leading with Impact series. Come and meet your peers with the aim of encouraging you to unpack your personal purpose and impact with others and to depart with a fresh sense of empowerment about whatâ€™s possible:Â Leading with Impact SeriesÂ Coaching & NetworkingTuesday 9th December at 6:30pmHEC UK House, 43 Parker Street, London WC2B 5PSÂ During the evening we will:Â Hear experiences from leaders among usÂ Share data points and anecdotes to help understand whatÂ leading with impact means forÂ each of us â€“ challenge and stretch our own ideasUse the power of peers to co-coach and embolden one anotherÂ The evening will be facilitated by Laure Fau.Â AboutÂ the Leading with Impact SeriesÂ Lizi and Laure host the series with the conviction that "Leading with Impact" is about working with peers to inspire and influence in order to make a positive, lasting difference in our respective careers and lives. We arenâ€™t focused on status or hierarchy, more the positive tangible and emotional outcomes which go beyond revenues and business goals to focus on empowering others, fostering sustainable growth, and convening space for shared visions. Â Each eventÂ aims to equip you with theÂ insights and stimuliÂ to go further and faster, boosting your resilience and tapping into your full potential for impact thanks to first-class speakers and facilitators,Â as well as a powerful network of peers.Â About Laure and LiziÂ Laure FauÂ has been running her Executive Coaching practice in France, Ireland and the UK since 2007. A HEC Alumni and former corporation tax consultant with PwC and EY, Laure works with managers and leaders to find â€™the little differences that can make the biggest differencesâ€™ in how they lead, make decisions and deliver the impact they aspire to have. Laure has three adult children and is a sports fanatic: she cycles daily around Paris and London, is a keen skier and triathlete as well as a Finisher of the Marathon des Sables 2023, and Grand to Grand 2024, having on these occasions run 250km over 6 days.Lizi AdamsÂ is a Partner at FTI Consulting where she advises investors and technology developers in the Energy Transition space. A former Wall Street Journal correspondent, Lizi helps clients to define who they are, what they do and why, and position themselves with clarity and veracity to achieve their commercial objectives. Lizi has sailed to Australia, lived on a boat in the Isle of Dogs for a year, and in summer 2024, moved with her young family to Wales to renovate and run a farm.Event RecapFormat: Interactive with facilitated discussions andÂ plenty ofÂ time for networkingÂ and co-coachingTiming: 6pm for a 6.30pm start, with formal proceedings until 8.30pm followed by drinksLocation: HEC UK House, , 43 Parker Street, London WC2B 5PSCost: Â£30/person including drinks and nibbles

title: Webinar "Ditch your "TO-DO" list: who do you need TO BE?" - March 13
description: When we want to make real changes, we need to change in a different way!We're often stuck in our to-do lists and they can feel neverending and all consuming. Worse, they stop us from making the big changes that we so often want.Â We feel "too busy" to even think about it. The to-do lists keep gettng in the way.Â Luckily, it's not a lot of time that we need, it's simply a different kind of "to do" list.Â Who do you need TO BE to make the changes you want?Your "to be" list is so much more powerful than your "to do" list.Â Think about a potential "to be" list: I am going to be courageous, to trust myself, to be confident that I can handle whatever comes my way... and compare it with your current "to do" list.Â Which is life changing?This webinar will help you identify what could be your "to be" list for right now and give you an insight into the power of coaching.Â The speaker: Ann CollinsAnn brings over 25 years of experience in education, training and coaching, as well as expertise in neuroscience and transformation. She has a proven track record of creating positive impact through her individual and team coaching programmes in the luxury, education, engineering and NGO sectors in Europe, Asia and the US.Â As a coach she is known for providing a challenging and supportive environment, but always with a positive and encouraging energy. Her mission is to support leaders (and their teams) to take confident steps towards their big goals whilst retaining their values and integrity.

title: Webinar ENG: Shine at your next job interview
description: Preparing for interview? Give yourself the best chance of success.Whether you want to get promoted or to land a job in another organization, the interview is usually a key step.However, depending on the context and the interviewer, being able to answer in a compelling way to every question is a challenge.The vast majority of interview advice and training mostly give you a long list of generic questions to prepare and standard questions to ask to make a good impression.Not only is this approach artificial but it does not enable you to differentiate yourself since everyone uses more or less the same basic sources and advice.Besides, it is impossible to anticipate every question. Therefore, when you get an unexpected question, itâ€™s easy to feel lost and, from then on, youâ€™re on slippery ground.Lastly, it makes you sound scripted whereas you need to be good Â« in the moment Â».If you want to shine whatever question comes up, traditional approaches are no longer enough. title: Webinar "Shine at your next job interview" - April 2nd
description: Preparing for an interview? Give yourself the best chance of success. Whether you want to get promoted or land a job in another organization, the interview is usually a key step.Â However, depending on the context and the interviewer, being able to answer in a compelling way to every question is a challenge.Â The vast majority of interview advice and training mostly give you a long list of generic questions to prepare and standard questions to ask to make a good impression.Â Not only is this approach artificial, but it does not enable you to differentiate yourself since everyone uses more or less the same basic sources and advice.Â Besides, it is impossible to anticipate every question. Therefore, when you get an unexpected question, itâ€™s easy to feel lost and, from then on, youâ€™re on slippery ground.Â Lastly, it makes you sound scripted, whereas you need to be good in the moment.Â If you want to shine whatever question comes up, traditional approaches are no longer enough. This webinar will enable you to go further by giving you the underlying principles of verbal communication behind a successful interview. So that you can answer with ease and poise whatever the question, even the trickiest one. The principles we will cover in this webinar have enabled senior executives, managers, and high-level specialists to land remarkable jobs in coveted organizations â€“ even in the challenging circumstances of a career change.The speaker: As Founder of CAREER ON PURPOSE, Oâ€™ona Souissi helps international executives and high-level experts build a meaningful career.

title: Webinar "Secrets of headhunters" - May 29
description: Lift myths and beliefs about a little-known professionÂ and discover the secrets to boost your career and/or your projectsÂ This workshop will give you all the keys to understand the job of headhunter:Â â€¢ What is an executive search firm?Â â€¢ Understand the differences between themÂ â€¢ Why does a company use the service of a headhunter?Â â€¢ Understand how they work and what they deliver to their clientsÂ â€¢ How do a consultant proceed and how does he select candidates ?Â â€¢ Understand the positioning of the consultant towards client & candidatesÂ â€¢ How to get chased? ... And how to hunt headhunters?Â â€¢ Ask everything you have ever wanted to know about the jobAt the end of this workshop:Â â€¢ You will discover how to be more visibleÂ â€¢ You will understand how headhunters can help you grow professionallyÂ â€¢ You will understand how they can help you in your recruitmentÂ â€¢ You will dare to use this profession for your projects Â This workshop is for you if... :Â â€¢ You would be interested in changing your job or you are actively looking for a new positionÂ â€¢ You want to develop your network in caseâ€¦Â â€¢ You want to use an executive search firms for your recruitment projects but do not know how it worksIn Summary:Â As an expert in recruitment, change and therefore career development, the headhunter is there to support leaders and guide them on the paths of professional advancement: Evaluate their professional and personal assets, redefine a project and a career strategy, help them find a new position but also find a talent for their teams, advise them and be at their side in a business project: a winning duo! Â The speaker: ClÃ©mence CojeanÂ has 20 years of experience in recruitment. Before joining the headhunting industry in 2012, she worked for 10 years for one of the world's leading engineering consulting companies. Today, she advises clients from different sectors, in a process of trust and partnership, in their search for senior executives and executives in France and abroad. Having lived 5 years as an expatriate in Europe, she notes that the way of recruiting and developing its career has changed in recent years and that it is becoming essential to adapt to new digital channels and to have a perfectly mastered digital identity. She is today one of the LinkedIn experts on the French market

title: Webinar "Ditch your "TO-DO" list: who do you need TO BE?" - September 28
description: When we want to make real changes, we need to change in a different way!We're often stuck in our to-do lists and they can feel neverending and all consuming. Worse, they stop us from making the big changes that we so often want.Â We feel "too busy" to even think about it. The to-do lists keep gettng in the way.Â Luckily, it's not a lot of time that we need, it's simply a different kind of "to do" list.Â Who do you need TO BE to make the changes you want?Your "to be" list is so much more powerful than your "to do" list.Â Think about a potential "to be" list: I am going to be courageous, to trust myself, to be confident that I can handle whatever comes my way... and compare it with your current "to do" list.Â Which is life changing?This webinar will help you identify what could be your "to be" list for right now and give you an insight into the power of coaching.Â The speaker: Ann CollinsAnn brings over 25 years of experience in education, training and coaching, as well as expertise in neuroscience and transformation. Her mission is to support leaders (and their teams) to take confident steps towards their big goals whilst retaining their values and integrity.
